glsa.title: T1Lib: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: T1Lib is vulnerable to a buffer overflow allowing for the user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: T1Lib is a library for rasterizing bitmaps from Adobe Type 1 fonts.

description.p: Hamid Ebadi discovered a boundary error in the intT1_EnvGetCompletePath() function which can lead to a buffer overflow when processing an overly long filename.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a font file with a specially crafted filename, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application using T1Lib.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
